hero.h1: Hack the system & win awesome prizes!
hero.p: Welcome to the 2015 Backbase Hackathon in Amsterdam and online, a two-day chance to network, learn and share knowledge with your peers next 19th and 20th of June 2015.
hero.link: Early bird registration until 1st of June

eta.p: Time left until the hackathon to organize:

description.p:
The Backbase Hackathon is hosting developers from all Backbase locations, providing an opportunity to create new application concepts to shake up the banking industry. This is achieved by combining technologies and making small, yet significant dents in some of the most difficult problems, in whatever language, in whatever framework, in whatever development stack, and time is your only enemy. It’s a unique opportunity to delve into open APIs and technologies to create new applications for banking customers (and other businesses).

The game is on! Are you in?

attendance.p: We’re looking for a creative mix of Backbase employees and (nearshore) partners for the two-day Hackathon – coders, designers and entrepreneurs!

prizes.p: Apart from eternal glory and a picture of the winning team placed on our office wall, there will be some amazing prizes for the winning teams.
prizes.dl1: <dt>Grand Winner of the Backbase 2015 Hackathon<dd>Wow factor, impact, innovation, feasibility
prizes.dl2: <dt>Lesser-but-nothing-short-of-Grand Winner<dd>Great accomplishment, very impressive, but still short of that one overwhelming sparkle
prizes.dl3: <dt>Fireworks Factor<dd>Very Creative, out of the box, not very feasible but still very impressive
prizes.dl4: <dt>Pink Panther<dd>Murphy's Law, great commitment but not able to execute because of bad luck

goals.p: You can basically compete in one of these categories:

goals.title: Free mode (you perform all the magic, with basic help if required)
rules: We will deliver a set of APIs so people can hack on top of them
We offer our Breeze API (the pre-made full model you already know )
Standalone model, too (no APIs and no products – just frameworks, libraries, coffee and pizza).
Documentation of Breeze API can be found here: URL

goals.title: Backbase CXP (we allow BB products, with you building on top of them)
rules: You can make use of any Backbase tools.

goals.title: Use of tooling around Backbase products, for instance ...
rules: Make use of command line tools
Use dashboards that display internal statistics
Make use of internal tools (to fill the time tracker based on your browser history)
git/stash/jira, or any other extension for any of our systems.

goals.final_p: There are so many more things you can probably think of. Just be creative, and leave the provision of food and timekeeping to us (because that’s what we’re good at).

apply.h3: Join us on this 2-day hackathon in Amsterdam!
apply.p:
The inaugural Backbase Hackathon invites you to apply today. Don’t waste time! Get this form filled in as soon as possible! The aim is to compete, so we can innovate together and move digital banking forwards. Here are some simple rules to abide by:

  1. Fresh hacking - This means you must present a brand new product or feature that didn’t exist before. Your hack must be crafted entirely during the hackathon.
  2. Work from a Backbase location – You can join the Hackathon remotely from any Backbase location. Please bring your own laptop.
  3. Sign up as a team– A team can consist of 1-5 members, and can comprise a mix of talents. For instance, a team could include a coder, a user experience expert, or an entrepreneur – any flavor will do.

At the end of the Hackathon, each team leader will present a 15-minute prototype demo to a jury of Backbase managers, as well as representatives of the Hackathon sponsor company.

survey.h3: Still doubting? Find more filling out our survey

brands.name: ITgma
brands.imgAlt: ITgma helps the companies to rethink

criteria.title: WOW Factor (25%)
criteria.description: Does your product make the judges go 'WOW!'?

criteria.title: Impact (25%)
criteria.description: Does it solve a real problem for millions of people?

criteria.title: Innovation (25%)
criteria.description: Is it completely new to the market?

rules.title: NO POWERPOINT
rules.description: You must present a live demo of your hack.

rules.title: FRESH CODE
rules.description: You must present a new thing that didn’t exist before or drastically improve one.

rules.title: TEAM SIZE
rules.description: Up to 5 humans per team. Each team may also have one robot or supernatural power.

inspiration.subtitle: Just in case you are stuck for ideas on what to develop at the Backbase Hackathon, here are a few areas to consider and get your creative juices flowing...

ideas.title: Stock Tracker
ideas.description: Use the Backbase Mobile SDK to create a new stock tracker app that visualizes how pepole look at their portfolio in a completely different way.

ideas.title: Analytics Power!
ideas.description: Add a new Analytics App to CXP Manager 5.6 that consumes the most needed reports from Google Analytics, in real time.

ideas.title: Bank 10.0
ideas.description: Visualize how the Bank of The Future would look like and create a Launchpad Theme to make it real. Inspiration?

apis.h2: APIs you might want to use
apis.subtitle: A micro-startup ecosystem is created per team in the 1st Backbase Hackathon. In order to support the needs of this small businesses we provide a versatile base for allowing integrations with your favorite frameworks and tools.

ideas.title: Open Bank Project
ideas.description: Want to develop a financial application which accesses bank account transactions? The Open Bank Project offers an easy-to-use RESTful JSON API. Connect in minutes and start using it. Here you can access their sandbox!

ideas.title: EnClout
ideas.description: Give a list of stock symbols, this API returns stock data using Yahoo Finance!

ideas.title: xignite
ideas.description: Xinite empowers the future of finance with a large set of financial market data API right in the cloud as real time quotes, extended loans and wide etcetera. Check an example on how to get real quotes.

ideas.title: Data.gov (opendata)
ideas.description: The home of the U.S. Government’s open data. Here you will find data, tools, and resources to conduct research, develop web and mobile applications, design data visualizations, and more. Explore hundreds of free data sets on financial services, including banking, lending, retirement, investments, and insurance. Start using these data sets to build new financial products and services, such as apps that help financial consumers and new models to help make loans to small businesses.

apis.footer: Still not satisfied? Not a problem! It's always easy to scrape the data you need! Just drop us your ideas or any question. We'll be glad to cook together with you!
